oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Mycoplasma species that cause mastitis in dairy cattle are often extremely contagious. In epidemics of mastitis caused by M. bovis, rapid and accurate diagnosis is essential for controlling the spread of this organism from cow to cow. An epidemic may be extremely costly to the producer if appropriate sampling and culture protocols are not promptly implemented. Unfortunately, few procedures for isolation of microorganisms are standardized across veterinary diagnostic laboratories. Mycoplasma culture techniques can vary greatly between laboratories. This study compared Mycoplasma culture results at four different laboratories in order to assess whether sensitivity and specificity were variable between laboratories.
